trans-unit.source: Defines the string comparison options to use with <see cref="T:System.Globalization.CompareInfo" />.
These options denote case sensitivity or necessity to ignore types of characters.
trans-unit.target: Queste opzioni indicano distinzione maiuscole/minuscole o se è necessario ignorare i tipi di caratteri.

trans-unit.source: The .NET Framework uses three distinct ways of sorting: word sort, string sort, and ordinal sort.
trans-unit.target: .NET Framework Usa tre diverse modalità di ordinamento: ordinamento, ordinamento stringa e ordinamento ordinali di word.

trans-unit.source: Word sort performs a culture-sensitive comparison of strings.
trans-unit.target: Ordinamento di Word esegue un confronto con distinzione delle impostazioni cultura delle stringhe.

trans-unit.source: Certain nonalphanumeric characters might have special weights assigned to them.
trans-unit.target: Alcuni caratteri non alfanumerici potrebbero essere determinati i pesi assegnati.

trans-unit.source: For example, the hyphen ("-") might have a very small weight assigned to it so that "coop" and "co-op" appear next to each other in a sorted list.
trans-unit.target: Ad esempio, il trattino ("-") potrebbe avere un peso molto piccolo assegnato in modo che "coop" e "co" vengono visualizzati uno accanto a altro in un elenco ordinato.

trans-unit.source: String sort is similar to word sort, except that there are no special cases.
trans-unit.target: Ordinamento di stringa è simile per ordinare in word, ad eccezione del fatto che esistono casi speciali.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, all nonalphanumeric symbols come before all alphanumeric characters.
trans-unit.target: Pertanto, tutti i simboli non alfanumerici precedono tutti i caratteri alfanumerici.

trans-unit.source: Ordinal sort compares strings based on the Unicode values of each element of the string.
trans-unit.target: Ordinamento ordinali confronta le stringhe in base ai valori Unicode di ogni elemento della stringa.

trans-unit.source: The StringSort value can only be used with <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.Compare%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> and <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.GetSortKey%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
trans-unit.target: Il valore di StringSort può essere utilizzato solo con <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.Compare%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> e <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.GetSortKey%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

trans-unit.source: <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown if the StringSort value is used with <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IsPrefix%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IsSuffix%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, or <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.LastIndexOf%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
trans-unit.target: <xref:System.ArgumentException> viene generata se viene utilizzato il valore di StringSort con <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IsPrefix%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IsSuffix%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>, o <xref:System.Globalization.CompareInfo.LastIndexOf%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

trans-unit.source: When possible, the application should use string comparison methods that accept a <xref:System.Globalization.CompareOptions> value to specify the kind of comparison expected.
trans-unit.target: Se possibile, l'applicazione deve utilizzare i metodi di confronto tra stringhe che accettano un <xref:System.Globalization.CompareOptions> valore per specificare il tipo di confronto previsto.

trans-unit.source: As a general rule, user-facing comparisons are best served by the use of linguistic options (using the current culture), while security comparisons should specify Ordinal or OrdinalIgnoreCase.
trans-unit.target: Come regola generale, i confronti rivolta all'utente vengono soddisfatti in modo ottimale per l'utilizzo di opzioni linguistiche, utilizzando le impostazioni cultura correnti, mentre la sicurezza, i confronti devono specificare Ordinal o OrdinalIgnoreCase.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how sorting with StringSort differs from sorting without StringSort.
trans-unit.target: Esempio di codice seguente viene illustrato come l'ordinamento con StringSort quello senza StringSort.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the string comparison must ignore case.
Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the Kana type.
Kana type refers to Japanese hiragana and katakana characters, which represent phonetic sounds in the Japanese language.
Hiragana is used for native Japanese expressions and words, while katakana is used for words borrowed from other languages, such as "computer" or "Internet".
A phonetic sound can be expressed in both hiragana and katakana.
If this value is selected, the hiragana character for one sound is considered equal to the katakana character for the same sound.
Indicates that the string comparison must ignore nonspacing combining characters, such as diacritics.
The [Unicode Standard](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=37123) defines combining characters as characters that are combined with base characters to produce a new character.
Nonspacing combining characters do not occupy a spacing position by themselves when rendered.
Indicates that the string comparison must ignore symbols, such as white-space characters, punctuation, currency symbols, the percent sign, mathematical symbols, the ampersand, and so on.
Indicates that the string comparison must ignore the character width.
For example, Japanese katakana characters can be written as full-width or half-width.
If this value is selected, the katakana characters written as full-width are considered equal to the same characters written as half-width.
Indicates the default option settings for string comparisons.

Indicates that the string comparison must use successive Unicode UTF-16 encoded values of the string (code unit by code unit comparison), leading to a fast comparison but one that is culture-insensitive.
A string starting with a code unit XXXX16 comes before a string starting with YYYY16, if XXXX16 is less than YYYY16.
This value cannot be combined with other <see cref="T:System.Globalization.CompareOptions" /> values and must be used alone.
String comparison must ignore case, then perform an ordinal comparison.
This technique is equivalent to converting the string to uppercase using the invariant culture and then performing an ordinal comparison on the result.
Indicates that the string comparison must use the string sort algorithm.
In a string sort, the hyphen and the apostrophe, as well as other nonalphanumeric symbols, come before alphanumeric characters.
